Key Match Events: Brazil defeated Chile 2-1 with an 89th-minute winner
Igor Jesus headed home to draw the visitors level before halftime
Luiz Henrique scored the winning goal with a low-driven effort in the 89th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Head coach Dorival Junior's men struggled without star man Vinicius Junior
Dorival's tactics were criticized, especially the midfield pairing which was removed at halftime
Post-Match Reflections: Dorival is under pressure after such a disjointed performance
The three points will come as a welcome relief to head coach Dorival Junior
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ederson had a solid performance despite conceding the first goal
Gabriel Magalhaes was Brazil's best player on the night, running the show defensively
